data.title: Englewood Cliffs Community Information
data.meta_description: Anat Eisenberg is pleased to provide you with a list of practical information on to the Englewood Cliffs community, all conveniently listed in one page.
data.text:
Englewood Cliffs Community info – Bergen County, NJ Homes

In this article you will find the following useful information:

Nurseries & Day Care

Saddle Acres Schools 106 Grand Ave, Englewood (201) 569-0055

My Little Bear 146 West St, Englewood (201) 894-1206

Promise Child Development Center 245 Tenafly Rd, Englewood,(201) 871-3733

West Side Infant Day Care Center 192 W Demarest Ave, Englewood, (201) 568-2571

See also the Tenafly Page

Cultural Life & Recreation

Being a neighbour to both Englewood and Tenafly Englewood Cliffs residents can enjoy the offerings of thes two towns. Englewood Cliffs offers limited recreational activities

The Bergen Performing Arts Center (bergenpac) offers world class entertainment just around the corner.The Bergen Performing Arts Center (bergenPAC) was conceived in the echoing corridors, empty rehearsal rooms and grand performance hall of the former John Harms Center, which closed to the shock and heartbreak of Bergen County’s large community of culture lovers, families and students. In April 2003, a group of concerned citizens, headed by Englewood resident Frank Huttle III, formed bergenPAC and developed a business plan to forge a true public/private partnership, engaging all sectors of the community and bringing together corporations, governments and residents, each adding the committment and support necessary to revitalize this unique arts center.

The Englewood Library is dedicated to providing information, education, culture and inspiration. The town encourages the community to pursue lifelong learning and the enjoyment of books, programs and resources in a variety of formats.

Department of Parks & Recreation offers a vaiety of parks and activities.Babe Ruth Field (Tryon Avenue), Cambridge Avenue Park (Cambridge Ave. & Knickerbocker), Crystal Lake (Sheffield Avenue), Denning Park (Lafayette Place & Forest Avenue), Depot Square Park (Demarest Avenue), Durie Park, Garrity Field, Glenbrook Park, Hudson Avenue Park, Morris Park, Trumbull Park, Tryon Ave. Pool, Winton White Stadium, and Mackay Park.

Little League (for children ages 8 to 12) is run by parent volunteers & sponsored by local businesses.
